Abadar - Major Boon.name: Abadar - Starker Segen
Abadar - Major Boon.description: Starker Segen (täglich): Deine Silberzunge ist unfehlbar, wodurch du eine Einigung erzielen kannst, wo immer sie auch nur im Entferntesten möglich ist. Einmal am Tag weißt du einfach, was du anbieten musst, um einen Handel zu machen oder in einer Verhandlung zu vermitteln. Sobald du dieses göttlich inspirierte Angebot machst, erhältst du automatisch ein Ergebnis von 20 + deinem Modifikator für Würfe für Diplomatie auf deinen Fertigkeitswurf für Diplomatie, anstatt zu würfeln. Dies erhöht jedoch nicht deinen Grad an Erfolg, wie es sonst bei einer 20 passieren würde. Falls es wirklich nichts gibt, was du anbieten könntest, um zu einer Einigung zu kommen, erfährst du das und verbrauchst damit nicht deine tägliche Anwendung dieses Segens.

Abadar - Major Curse.name: Abadar - Starker Fluch
Abadar - Major Curse.description: You become honest to a fault. You constantly suffer the critical failure effect of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aewxsale5xWEPKLk]{Ring of Truth}. Additionally, you are always offered the worst possible option in a bargain.

Abadar - Minor Boon.name: Abadar - Schwacher Segen
Abadar - Minor Boon.description: Schwacher Segen (einmalig): Abadar warnt seine Lieblinge vor denen, die ungerechterweise etwas ausnutzen wollen. Wenn jemand einen Erfolg bei einem Fertigkeitswurf für Täuschung erzielt, um dich und nur dich zu Belügen, erzielt er stattdessen einmalig einen kritischen Fehlschlag. Abadar entscheidet sich normalerweise dafür, diesen Segen zu schenken, wenn die Lüge äußerst starke Konsequenzen hätte.

Abadar - Minor Curse.name: Abadar - Schwacher Fluch
Abadar - Minor Curse.description: Any time you steal, illegally harm or kill another creature, or undermine a law-abiding officer or court, a symbol or word describing your crime appears on a visible spot on your skin. This symbol cannot be removed or hidden with makeup (though it can be covered with clothing) and it doesn't vanish until you make legal restitution for the crime, such as by serving your sentence.

Abadar - Moderate Boon.name: Abadar - Normaler Segen
Abadar - Moderate Boon.description:
Abadar blesses all your enterprises, leading to financial success as all your ventures always seems to work out.

If you roll a critical failure at a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income}, you get a failure instead.

If you roll a success on a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income}, you earn twice the usual amount of income.

Abadar - Moderate Curse.name: Abadar - Normaler Fluch
Abadar - Moderate Curse.description: Abadar curses all your enterprises, leading to financial disaster as all your ventures always seem to fail. The result of your check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income} is always one degree of success worse than the one you rolled.

Achaekek - Major Boon.name: Achaekek - Starker Segen
Achaekek - Major Boon.description: Death lives in your very blade. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.j1JE61quDxdge4mg]{Sneak Attack} rogue class feature, dealing 3d6 precision damage. if you already have that class feature, you increase your sneak attack damage by 3d6.

Achaekek - Major Curse.name: Achaekek - Starker Fluch
Achaekek - Major Curse.description: The Mantis God doesn't waste his time toying with or tormenting those who truly anger him, or those who dare to consider themselves divine. He rips open a portal to your location, kills you, drags your soul to judgment in a way that prevents resurrection magic, and then leaves.

Achaekek - Minor Boon.name: Achaekek - Schwacher Segen
Achaekek - Minor Boon.description: You hide among the shadows of death. Once, when you would fail a Stealth check, you critically succeed instead. Achaekek typically grants this boon for an extremely consequential Stealth check that could lead to an assassination, such as one that could get you into position to kill an important target, but rarely on a Stealth check to help you escape.

Achaekek - Minor Curse.name: Achaekek - Schwacher Fluch
Achaekek - Minor Curse.description: Achaekek's minions seek vengeance. Nonsapient insects (especially mantises) become hostile against you.

Achaekek - Moderate Boon.name: Achaekek - Normaler Segen
Achaekek - Moderate Boon.description: You gain the god's approval to take a life. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dLdRqT6UxTKlsPgp]{Death Knell} once per day as an innate divine spell.

Achaekek - Moderate Curse.name: Achaekek - Normaler Fluch
Achaekek - Moderate Curse.description: Hubris brings death. Your name and location are mentally projected into the mind of a Red Mantis assassin, who is tasked with eliminating you.

Alseta - Major Boon.name: Alseta - Starker Segen
Alseta - Major Boon.description: You transition unimpeded through the world. You can open any door or portal simply by placing your palm upon it with a single @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact} action, even if it's locked or magically sealed, and you can enter any open door or threshold, even if it's magically warded to prevent entry. This doesn't overcome the locks and magic of artifacts, deities, and similarly powerful effects.

Alseta - Major Curse.name: Alseta - Starker Fluch
Alseta - Major Curse.description: Transportation magic no longer works for you. You cannot be transported by any magical means, nor can you transport, conjure, or summon others. Even extradimensional spaces like bags of holding are inaccessible and unusable to you, as using them requires magical transportation to the extradimensional space.

Alseta - Minor Boon.name: Alseta - Schwacher Segen
Alseta - Minor Boon.description: Alseta's guiding hand aids your journeys. Once, when employing teleportation magic, you appear exactly on target, even if you used a notoriously imprecise spell like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]{Interplanar Teleport}. Alseta typically grants this boon for extremely consequential magical travel, especially when time is of the essence.

Alseta - Minor Curse.name: Alseta - Schwacher Fluch
Alseta - Minor Curse.description: Doors jam and locks stick when you try to open them. It takes 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact} actions for you to open even an unlocked door, and each attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick a Lock} takes you 2 rounds instead of 2 actions.

Alseta - Moderate Boon.name: Alseta - Normaler Segen
Alseta - Moderate Boon.description: New doors open themselves for you. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6Ot4N22t5tPD51BO]{Knock} once per day as a divine innate spell.

Alseta - Moderate Curse.name: Alseta - Normaler Fluch
Alseta - Moderate Curse.description: Crossing thresholds becomes daunting. Whenever you move through a portal, gateway, or door, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} condition. Magical travel is even more exhausting; after traveling via teleportation, plane shift, or the like, you also gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} condition until you get a full night's rest.

Arazni - Major Boon.name: Arazni - Starker Segen
Arazni - Major Boon.description: Upon death, you return to life with the effects of a critical success on a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual to enact vengeance against your killers. When you successfully achieve vengeance, abandon your vengeance for other pursuits, or fail outright, you crumble to scarlet dust.

Arazni - Major Curse.name: Arazni - Starker Fluch
Arazni - Major Curse.description: When you would regain Hit Points due to either a vitality or void effect, you lose that many Hit Points instead.

Arazni - Minor Boon.name: Arazni - Schwacher Segen
Arazni - Minor Boon.description: Once, when you fail a saving throw against an effect that would compel you to take some action against your will, you critically succeed instead. Arazni typically grants this boon for consequential actions or particularly egregious violations of free will.

Arazni - Minor Curse.name: Arazni - Schwacher Fluch
Arazni - Minor Curse.description: Someone you've wronged gains information they desire about you, with the effects of a critical success at the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7DN13ILADW2N9Z1t]{Commune} ritual.

Arazni - Moderate Boon.name: Arazni - Normaler Segen
Arazni - Moderate Boon.description: Blood from your wounds forms into armor or a piece of equipment you need. If what you need most is information, the blood forms letters spelling out that information.

Arazni - Moderate Curse.name: Arazni - Normaler Fluch
Arazni - Moderate Curse.description: Creatures weaker than you gain a status bonus on all attack rolls against you equal to your difference in levels, to a maximum of +4. Whenever you are damaged by a such a creature, you take persistent bleed damage equal to twice the difference between your levels (no maximum).

Asmodeus - Major Boon.name: Asmodeus - Starker Segen
Asmodeus - Major Boon.description: Asmodeus helps enforce your bargains and contracts. When a creature enters a bargain or contract with you, uncoerced and of its own free will, it can't voluntarily violate its side of the bargain as long as you uphold your side. You can always choose to violate the bargain yourself, but if you do, the creature is no longer bound to fulfill its part.

Asmodeus - Major Curse.name: Asmodeus - Starker Fluch
Asmodeus - Major Curse.description:
Asmodeus has taken note of the chaos you have wrought. You receive an ancient wound that feels older than time itself. You become permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}, and nothing short of another intercession can remove the condition.

Your wound aches fiercely whenever you perform a particularly chaotic act, causing you to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Asmodeus - Minor Boon.name: Asmodeus - Schwacher Segen
Asmodeus - Minor Boon.description: Schwacher Segen (einmalig): Asmodeus ist angetan von deinem Talent zur Manipulation und verstärkt deine Fähigkeiten noch. Wenn du einmalig etwas Wichtiges @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Erbitten} möchtest und bei dem dazu benötigten Wurf für Diplomatie einen Fehlschlag erzielst, kannst du @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Einflüsterung} auf das Ziel zaubern und dasselbe nahelegen. Dies ist ein göttlicher immanenter Zauber.

Asmodeus - Minor Curse.name: Asmodeus - Schwacher Fluch
Asmodeus - Minor Curse.description: Asmodeus's flames burn you with great malice. You gain weakness 5 to fire.

Asmodeus - Moderate Boon.name: Asmodeus - Normaler Segen
Asmodeus - Moderate Boon.description: Your eyes glow red like embers and your skin takes on a crimson tone. You gain darkvision and fire resistance 5.

Asmodeus - Moderate Curse.name: Asmodeus - Normaler Fluch
Asmodeus - Moderate Curse.description: Asmodeus forces your compliance. You can't voluntarily back out of an agreement or contract or go back on your word, though you need follow only the letter of the agreement, not the spirit.

Besmara - Major Boon.name: Besmara - Starker Segen
Besmara - Major Boon.description: You seem to be unaffected by storms. You ignore all effects and penalties caused by precipitation and winds, and you can see normally through fog, rain, and other weather conditions.

Besmara - Major Curse.name: Besmara - Starker Fluch
Besmara - Major Curse.description: You meet extreme financial ruin for daring to gravely offend the Pirate Queen. Besmara's agents steal all your booty and bring the spoils to Besmara's ship, Seawraith. If you want a chance to recover your lost wealth, you must parlay with the goddess and accept whatever dangerous terms she offers, usually requiring a heist she will find sufficiently amusing to watch whether you succeed or fail, and requiring you to trade your spoils from that quest for your previous belongings.

Besmara - Minor Boon.name: Besmara - Schwacher Segen
Besmara - Minor Boon.description: Besmara wants you to amuse her, placing both plunder and peril in your path. This intercession often takes the form of an unexpected treasure map, a message in a bottle, or some other sign leading you to a great reward, assuming you can handle the challenges along the way.

Besmara - Minor Curse.name: Besmara - Schwacher Fluch
Besmara - Minor Curse.description: You feel some of the effects of scurvy, making your wounds flow more easily. The DC of the flat check for you to remove persistent bleed damage is 20 instead of 15 (or 15 instead of 10 if using extremely efficient methods to assist your recovery), and you don't recover from persistent bleed damage automatically when you reach full Hit Points.

Besmara - Moderate Boon.name: Besmara - Normaler Segen
Besmara - Moderate Boon.description: You are at home on the seas and always ready to plunder an enemy vessel or defend your own. When aboard a boat, you gain a +2 status bonus to all initiative rolls, Acrobatics checks to Balance, and Athletics checks to Climb. In addition, you never get seasick.

Besmara - Moderate Curse.name: Besmara - Normaler Fluch
Besmara - Moderate Curse.description: You get seasick, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} whenever you can see the sea or are on a boat at sea. You can't reduce this condition until you can no longer see the sea or are off the boat, though you can manage to stomach enough food and water to survive on a voyage, with extreme discomfort.

Brigh - Major Boon.name: Brigh - Starker Segen
Brigh - Major Boon.description: You gain the companionship of a loyal construct ally of Brigh's choice at least 1 level lower than you. If the construct is destroyed, it rebuilds itself over the course of a week, and as you gain levels, the construct upgrades and improves itself, becoming more powerful.

Brigh - Major Curse.name: Brigh - Starker Fluch
Brigh - Major Curse.description: Constructs—even mindless constructs you thought you could control—seek your demise. All constructs are hostile to you and attack you when they notice your presence. Occasionally, inanimate statues and other objects animate as constructs to pursue Brigh's vengeance.

Brigh - Minor Boon.name: Brigh - Schwacher Segen
Brigh - Minor Boon.description: Knowledge floods your mind. Once, you can reroll a failed skill check to Recall Knowledge; you must use the second result, even if it's worse.

Brigh - Minor Curse.name: Brigh - Schwacher Fluch
Brigh - Minor Curse.description: Your hands shake when attempting delicate work. All your failures to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.bT3skovyLUtP22ME]{Repair} items are instead critical failures.

Brigh - Moderate Boon.name: Brigh - Normaler Segen
Brigh - Moderate Boon.description: You become a wellspring of invention. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.XR95taODq1sq82Du]{Inventor} feat, even if you don't meet its prerequisites, and when you roll a Crafting check for the Inventor feat, you use the result one degree of success better than the result you rolled.

Brigh - Moderate Curse.name: Brigh - Normaler Fluch
Brigh - Moderate Curse.description: Whenever you try to perform engineering or science tasks, everything just seems to explode. Whenever you attempt to create or use an alchemical item or a construct, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device}, and so on, you must attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:15]. On a failure, something explodes and you take 1d6 fire damage (or a different type of damage, if appropriate) per level of the item, construct, or device (@Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true] save).

Calistria - Major Boon.name: Calistria - Starker Segen
Calistria - Major Boon.description: Calistria guides you towards vengeance. You always know the direction and distance towards the nearest creature that has wronged you and thus far gone unpunished.

Calistria - Major Curse.name: Calistria - Starker Fluch
Calistria - Major Curse.description:
You have wronged those unable to obtain revenge for themselves, and Calistria's curse grants their revenge its own life.

Whenever another creature imagines vengeance upon you but can't pursue that vengeance because you are too powerful, well connected, or otherwise untouchable, a creature of roughly your level manifests out of their imagination and performs their desired revenge.

Once the revenge is complete or the manifestation is destroyed, the summoned creature vanishes from existence.

Calistria - Minor Boon.name: Calistria - Schwacher Segen
Calistria - Minor Boon.description: Schwacher Segen (einmalig): Calistria unterstützt riskante Täuschungsmanöver. Wenn du einen Fehlschlag bei einem Fertigkeitswurf zum @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lügen} erzielst, erhältst du einmalig einen Kritischen Erfolg. Calistria verleiht diesen Segen oft dann, wenn die Lüge große Konsequenzen hätte.

Calistria - Minor Curse.name: Calistria - Schwacher Fluch
Calistria - Minor Curse.description: Whenever a new person desires vengeance against you, you suffer a painful sting and are afflicted with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.aBOPYlfHAcXUmhF7]{Giant Wasp Venom} at stage 1.

Calistria - Moderate Boon.name: Calistria - Normaler Segen
Calistria - Moderate Boon.description: A foot-long wasp finds and befriends you. It serves you as a familiar as long as you maintain Calistria's grace. The wasp always has the burrower and flier familiar abilities.

Calistria - Moderate Curse.name: Calistria - Normaler Fluch
Calistria - Moderate Curse.description: People react as though you're insulting them, even in normal conversation. Whenever you attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, the outcome is one degree of success worse than the result of your roll. If you converse with someone over a long enough period of time but don't attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, you still insult them, and you suffer the effect of a critical failure to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}.

Casandalee - Major Boon.name: Casanda - Starker Segen
Casandalee - Major Boon.description: Casandalee backs up your memory and soul within her divine data flow. After you die, she casts your consciousness into a new artificial body. While Casandalee constructed your new body artificially, it is otherwise similar to the old, with the same effects as a critical success on a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual. Casandalee is instead willing to provide different bodies to those who request them.

Casandalee - Major Curse.name: Casanda - Starker Fluch
Casandalee - Major Curse.description: The code of your soul is constantly being rewritten, and not for the better. You are never temporarily immune against a harmful effect.

Casandalee - Minor Boon.name: Casanda - Schwacher Segen
Casandalee - Minor Boon.description: Casandalee frees your thinking from dangerous control. Once, when you fail a Will save against an effect that would control your actions, you critically succeed instead. Casandalee typically grants this boon for particularly consequential violations of autonomy and agency.

Casandalee - Minor Curse.name: Casanda - Schwacher Fluch
Casandalee - Minor Curse.description: Your joints stiffen, and your mind becomes clouded. You take a -2 status penalty to all rolls for initiative.

Casandalee - Moderate Boon.name: Casanda - Normaler Segen
Casandalee - Moderate Boon.description: Your organs are partially transformed into mechanical counterparts. You gain resistance 10 to void damage, and the DC of your flat check to remove persistent bleed damage is only 5.

Casandalee - Moderate Curse.name: Casanda - Normaler Fluch
Casandalee - Moderate Curse.description: Casandalee attempts to bring you unwanted intellectual advancement to help you become something better. Each day, at some point during the day, Casandalee bestows a strange insight upon you that you find uncomfortable. If you embrace it, you aren't otherwise affected, but if you don't, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 10 minutes.

Cayden Cailean - Major Boon.name: Cayden Cailean - Starker Segen
Cayden Cailean - Major Boon.description: An embodiment of freedom, you break fetters with ease. At the end of each of your turns, you can end one effect that is currently making you immobilized (including effects that make you immobilized by grabbing or restraining you) as a free action.

Cayden Cailean - Major Curse.name: Cayden Cailean - Starker Fluch
Cayden Cailean - Major Curse.description:
Cayden curses you to suffer in the presence of drinking, making it hard for you to bear entering any tavern.

Whenever any creature drinks alcohol within 100 feet of you, you suffer all negative effects from the alcohol (but only the alcohol) instead. This doesn't apply if the creature gains any special effect from drinking alcohol.

Cayden Cailean - Minor Boon.name: Cayden Cailean - Schwacher Segen
Cayden Cailean - Minor Boon.description:
Cayden Cailean helps you recover from nights of carousing.

While you still get drunk and otherwise experience the effects of alcohol normally, you are never hung over the next morning.

Cayden Cailean - Minor Curse.name: Cayden Cailean - Schwacher Fluch
Cayden Cailean - Minor Curse.description: Individuals who raise Cayden's passing displeasure awake as if from a hard night of drinking and find that drink tastes foul.

Cayden Cailean - Moderate Boon.name: Cayden Cailean - Normaler Segen
Cayden Cailean - Moderate Boon.description:
You share some of the bravery Cayden espoused during his ascension.

When you roll a success on a saving throw against a fear effect, you get a critical success instead. If you have the fighter @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.GJKJafDGuX4BeAeN]{Bravery} class feature, when you roll a critical failure on a save against a fear effect, you get a failure instead.

Cayden Cailean - Moderate Curse.name: Cayden Cailean - Normaler Fluch
Cayden Cailean - Moderate Curse.description: Cayden has afflicted you with cowardice. Whenever you roll a critical success on a saving throw against a fear effect, you get a success instead, and each time you roll a failure on a saving throw against a fear effect, you get a critical failure instead.

Chaldira - Major Boon.name: Chaldira - Starker Segen
Chaldira - Major Boon.description: Chaldira's major boon grants truly improbable luck in combat. Your movement doesn't trigger reactions. You always succeed at flat checks you make to hit opponents with attack actions; this is a fortune effect.

Chaldira - Major Curse.name: Chaldira - Starker Fluch
Chaldira - Major Curse.description: Ill luck causes even once-certain aid to fail with frustrating regularity. You cannot benefit from circumstance or status bonuses, or from fortune effects.

Chaldira - Minor Boon.name: Chaldira - Schwacher Segen
Chaldira - Minor Boon.description: Once, you can choose the result of the next ordinary coin you flip or ordinary die you roll. If this ability is used for personal gain at the expense of someone innocent or less fortunate, Chaldira levies her moderate curse on you as punishment.

Chaldira - Minor Curse.name: Chaldira - Schwacher Fluch
Chaldira - Minor Curse.description: Any time you refuse a request made in good faith, you vomit up a frog, mouse, or other small animal. This deals no damage and causes no conditions, but is obvious to all bystanders.

Chaldira - Moderate Boon.name: Chaldira - Normaler Segen
Chaldira - Moderate Boon.description: You gain a lucky impetuousness, allowing you to roll for initiative twice and use the higher result once per day. This is a fortune effect.

Chaldira - Moderate Curse.name: Chaldira - Normaler Fluch
Chaldira - Moderate Curse.description: You are plagued with ill luck just when fortune is most needed. You must always roll flat checks twice and use the worse result. This is a misfortune effect.

Desna - Major Boon.name: Desna - Starker Segen
Desna - Major Boon.description: Desna bestows you with a swirling cloud of lights that forms a pair of wondrous butterfly wings. These wings grant you a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Fly} Speed of 40 feet and shine dim light to a range of 20 feet.

Desna - Major Curse.name: Desna - Starker Fluch
Desna - Major Curse.description: The stars rebuke you for your ways. You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 4} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} whenever you are exposed to starlight.

Desna - Minor Boon.name: Desna - Schwacher Segen
Desna - Minor Boon.description: Schwacher Segen: Jenen, die am Ende einer Reise stehen, schenkt Desna einen tiefen Schlaf. Du erlangst einmalig nach der Rast alle Trefferpunkte zurück, wirst von allen negativen Zuständen befreit und von allen Flüchen und Krankheiten geheilt.

Desna - Minor Curse.name: Desna - Schwacher Fluch
Desna - Minor Curse.description:
You always seem to lose your way or have strange mishaps on the road that delay your travel.

You (and thus any group that travels with you) travel at only 3/4 normal exploration Speed, before taking into account the terrain and other features that might slow you down further.

Desna - Moderate Boon.name: Desna - Normaler Segen
Desna - Moderate Boon.description: Normaler Segen: Desna wendet das Glück zu deinen Gunsten. Einmal am Tag kannst du, nachdem du einen Wurf abgelegt hast, diesen wiederholen und das neue Ergebnis nutzen.

Desna - Moderate Curse.name: Desna - Normaler Fluch
Desna - Moderate Curse.description:
Misfortune follows you in your travels and requires acts of contrition or benevolence to keep at bay.

You must always roll twice and take the worst result when attempting a check. This is a misfortune effect.

You can express your remorse and ignore this effect for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} by spending an action, which has the concentrate trait.

If you perform a truly selfless act of compassion, you ignore this effect for 1 day.

Erastil - Major Boon.name: Erastil - Starker Segen
Erastil - Major Boon.description:
You become a friend to the land. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qvwIwJ9QBihy8R0t]{Speak with Plants} as a divine innate spell.

When you are in a healthy natural environment, the land sustains you without need for food or drink.

You can cast the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7DN13ILADW2N9Z1t]{Commune} ritual without any secondary casters or secondary checks.

Erastil - Major Curse.name: Erastil - Starker Fluch
Erastil - Major Curse.description: Erastil leaves you unable to have children (or otherwise reproduce or propagate if you do so in a different manner). This curse also affects your livestock, pets, and crops.

Erastil - Minor Boon.name: Erastil - Schwacher Segen
Erastil - Minor Boon.description: Erastil shares in his bounty as long as you work for it. Whenever you roll a critical failure at a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.49y9Ec4bDii8pcD3]{Subsist} in the wild, you get a failure instead.

Erastil - Minor Curse.name: Erastil - Schwacher Fluch
Erastil - Minor Curse.description: Erastil curses your table and punishes you for relying on others' hard work. Any food you didn't grow, gather, or otherwise harvest yourself tastes like ash and leaves you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

Erastil - Moderate Boon.name: Erastil - Normaler Segen
Erastil - Moderate Boon.description:
You share Erastil's sharp eye, allowing you to use a longbow in any situation.

When you attack with a longbow, you can ignore the longbow's volley trait, and longbows have double the normal range increment for you.

Erastil - Moderate Curse.name: Erastil - Normaler Fluch
Erastil - Moderate Curse.description: Erastil's beasts take a dislike to you. Animals' attitudes toward you are one category worse (friendly instead of helpful, indifferent instead of friendly, and so on).

Ghlaunder - Major Boon.name: Ghlaunder - Starker Segen
Ghlaunder - Major Boon.description: Ghlaunder rewards his followers with the ability to safely spread illness—or on occasion, offers respite to desperate petitioners who please him. You do not take negative effects from any disease you are infected with unless or until Ghlaunder rescinds this benefit.

Ghlaunder - Major Curse.name: Ghlaunder - Starker Fluch
Ghlaunder - Major Curse.description: You are struck with a contagious disease of the GM's choice. You and anyone else you infect can't be cured of the disease or improve its condition to an earlier stage in any way until you infect two other sapient beings with the disease.

Ghlaunder - Minor Boon.name: Ghlaunder - Schwacher Segen
Ghlaunder - Minor Boon.description: Your commitment to filth draws a small cloud of disease-laden insects. Once, you can summon a cloud of midges, mosquitos, and flies to surround you for 1 minute. Creatures adjacent to you at any point during that time become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and exposed to a blood-borne illness. Ghlaunder typically grants this boon when you can infect a significant number of creatures.

Ghlaunder - Minor Curse.name: Ghlaunder - Schwacher Fluch
Ghlaunder - Minor Curse.description: Ghlaunder drains away your life force for himself. You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and can't reduce your drained condition below 1.

Ghlaunder - Moderate Boon.name: Ghlaunder - Normaler Segen
Ghlaunder - Moderate Boon.description: Ghlaunder teaches you to bide your time, corrupting and infecting until the time is right. When you expose a creature to a disease and it succeeds at its Fortitude save, it is still infected unless it critically succeeds. However, such a creature experiences no effects and the disease does not progress for the first 24 hours, even if the disease is normally fast-acting or someone uses another ability to progress the disease. It's very difficult to detect the infection in the first day; the DC for Medicine checks to do so is 5 higher.

Ghlaunder - Moderate Curse.name: Ghlaunder - Normaler Fluch
Ghlaunder - Moderate Curse.description: Ghlaunder leeches your energy from you as easily as blood. Any time you fail a Fortitude save, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} in addition to all other effects.

Gorum - Major Boon.name: Gorum - Starker Segen
Gorum - Major Boon.description:
Gorum feeds you the zeal of his undying warriors, allowing you to draw upon your own life force to fight on and on without falling.

Whenever you would be reduced to 0 Hit Points, you are instead healed to half your maximum Hit Points and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} (or increase your doomed condition by 1).

Gorum - Major Curse.name: Gorum - Starker Fluch
Gorum - Major Curse.description: You are unable to keep up with the rigors of combat. The moment a combat breaks out, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. At the end of each of your turns, your @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} condition increases by 1. These conditions end only when you are no longer in combat.

Gorum - Minor Boon.name: Gorum - Schwacher Segen
Gorum - Minor Boon.description: Gorum grants you a weapon whenever you need one. You can use an Interact action to draw a 0-level non-magical iron weapon, even if you have no weapons on your person. Such a weapon lasts only as long as you continue using it to attack, and it can't be sold, given away, melted for scrap iron, or the like.

Gorum - Minor Curse.name: Gorum - Schwacher Fluch
Gorum - Minor Curse.description: Gorum rewards cowardice with frailty. Any armor you wear and shield you wield reduces its item bonus to AC by 2 (minimum 0) and its Hardness, Hit Points, and Break Threshold by half.

Gorum - Moderate Boon.name: Gorum - Normaler Segen
Gorum - Moderate Boon.description: Your blows become unstoppable, carrying the momentum of Gorum's thrill for battle. Your greatsword Strikes gain the forceful trait.

Gorum - Moderate Curse.name: Gorum - Normaler Fluch
Gorum - Moderate Curse.description:
You've lost the glory of slaying a worthy opponent.

All of your weapon and unarmed attacks decrease their damage dice by one step, and all your attacks are nonlethal.

Gozreh - Major Boon.name: Gozreh - Starker Segen
Gozreh - Major Boon.description: Gozreh has blessed you with their wind in your stride. You gain a +30-foot status bonus to your Speeds, and you gain a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Fly} Speed equal to your land Speed.

Gozreh - Major Curse.name: Gozreh - Starker Fluch
Gozreh - Major Curse.description:
Those who displease Gozreh are shunned by nature itself.

All animals and nonsapient plant creatures are hostile to you, and any animal companion or familiar abandons you.

Sapient plants' attitude toward you begins two categories worse than normal, as something about you seems repugnant to them.

While plants and animals might not attack you outright if it's not normally in their nature to do so when they are hostile, dogs growl at you, cats hiss, and so on.

Gozreh - Minor Boon.name: Gozreh - Schwacher Segen
Gozreh - Minor Boon.description: Gozreh grants their guidance while at sea. You are under the constant effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tXa5vOu5giBNCjdR]{Know the Way} and become trained in Sailing Lore (or another Lore skill if you are already trained in Sailing Lore).

Gozreh - Minor Curse.name: Gozreh - Schwacher Fluch
Gozreh - Minor Curse.description: Lightning begins to strike twice. You gain weakness 5 to electricity, and any natural or magical bolts of lightning always target you rather than the other creatures around you.

Gozreh - Moderate Boon.name: Gozreh - Normaler Segen
Gozreh - Moderate Boon.description: You gain the touch of the sea. You can breathe underwater and gain a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swim} Speed equal to your land Speed.

Gozreh - Moderate Curse.name: Gozreh - Normaler Fluch
Gozreh - Moderate Curse.description:
The current of the waves constantly fights against you, putting you at risk of drowning any time you must Swim.

You lose any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swim} Speed you have, unless it's your only Speed, in which case you take a -20-foot status penalty to your swim Speed.

When you roll an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swim}, you always use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of your roll.

Grandmother Spider - Major Boon.name: Großmutter Spinne - Starker Segen
Grandmother Spider - Major Boon.description: Grandmother Spider rejoices in freedom and tricks those who would limit it. Any time you would become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:10]. On a success, you ignore the effect, and the originator of the effect becomes grabbed, immobilized, or restrained instead. If this simply causes a creature to grab itself, it can usually @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} as a free action, but it might be stuck if it tried to immobilize you in other ways.

Grandmother Spider - Major Curse.name: Großmutter Spinne - Starker Fluch
Grandmother Spider - Major Curse.description: Grandmother Spider throws all of her might behind the underdog. Any time a creature with a level lower than yours rolls a success on a check against you, it critically succeeds instead; any time you roll a failure on a check against a creature with a level lower than yours, you critically fail instead.

Grandmother Spider - Minor Boon.name: Großmutter Spinne - Schwacher Segen
Grandmother Spider - Minor Boon.description: Grandmother Spider rescues your prank from the jaws of failure. Once, when you would fail a Deception check, you critically succeed instead. Grandmother Spider typically grants this boon for deceptions that are necessary for an interesting or consequential prank.

Grandmother Spider - Minor Curse.name: Großmutter Spinne - Schwacher Fluch
Grandmother Spider - Minor Curse.description: When your pranks start going wrong, they dissolve into a string of catastrophic failures. When you roll a failure on a Deception or Stealth check, you get a critical failure instead.

Grandmother Spider - Moderate Boon.name: Großmutter Spinne - Normaler Segen
Grandmother Spider - Moderate Boon.description: You can feel tugs on the strands of fate. You gain a +2 status bonus to initiative rolls.

Grandmother Spider - Moderate Curse.name: Großmutter Spinne - Normaler Fluch
Grandmother Spider - Moderate Curse.description: Grandmother Spider weaves a web to ensnare you, and you trail webs behind you wherever you go. You become permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and take a -10-foot circumstance penalty to your Speeds.

Groetus - Major Boon.name: Groetus - Starker Segen
Groetus - Major Boon.description: Your touch unravels things that have survived past their appointed time, according to Groetus's reckoning. Such a creature or object takes @Damage[10d6[void]] damage each round you continue touching it; the damage ignores all Hardness and is capable of destroying nonliving objects, creatures immune to void effects, and even undead or other creatures with void healing. This boon might even be able to destroy some artifacts that have survived past their time.

Groetus - Major Curse.name: Groetus - Starker Fluch
Groetus - Major Curse.description: You bring about the end to everything around you. Every item you carry or wear gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken} condition after 10 minutes of exposure to you, and is destroyed after a further hour. This effect can't destroy artifacts or items of similar power.

Groetus - Minor Boon.name: Groetus - Schwacher Segen
Groetus - Minor Boon.description: You wield power over disorder. Once, when you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, you act normally enough to control your own actions in combat without penalty for the duration, though you still babble incoherently and otherwise behave strangely.

Groetus - Minor Curse.name: Groetus - Schwacher Fluch
Groetus - Minor Curse.description: Whenever you are illuminated by a light source other than natural sunlight, your head appears to be a bare skull. The DC for your recovery checks is 12 + your dying value, rather than 10 + your dying value, and you don't benefit from effects that reduce the DC, such as from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.AmP0qu7c5dlBSath]{Toughness} feat.

Groetus - Moderate Boon.name: Groetus - Normaler Segen
Groetus - Moderate Boon.description: Groetus grants you knowledge to further the end times. Each week, he sends you a cryptic, incoherent message about something important to the end times that will happen in the coming week.

Groetus - Moderate Curse.name: Groetus - Normaler Fluch
Groetus - Moderate Curse.description: The horrors at the end of reality become overwhelming and constantly race through your mind. You are permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

Gruhastha - Major Boon.name: Gruhastha - Starker Segen
Gruhastha - Major Boon.description: You are a divine inspiration to others around you. When attempting any checks to Recall Knowledge, you can roll twice and use the better result; this is a fortune effect. Additionally, allies within 60 feet gain a +2 status bonus to Will saves.

Gruhastha - Major Curse.name: Gruhastha - Starker Fluch
Gruhastha - Major Curse.description: The written word turns against you, blurring into illegibility. You are incapable of reading anything or making out symbols of any sort, including the words on scrolls, spellbooks, or magic items.

Gruhastha - Minor Boon.name: Gruhastha - Schwacher Segen
Gruhastha - Minor Boon.description: Books fall open to insightful passages, and memories spring to mind when they are most needed. Once, when you fail a check to Recall Knowledge, you critically succeed instead. Gruhastha typically grants this boon for an extremely consequential attempt to Recall Knowledge, particularly when misinformation would have dire consequences.

Gruhastha - Minor Curse.name: Gruhastha - Schwacher Fluch
Gruhastha - Minor Curse.description: As you stray from the truth, dissonant notes seem to interrupt you whenever you speak. You take a -2 status penalty to all Deception checks.

Gruhastha - Moderate Boon.name: Gruhastha - Normaler Segen
Gruhastha - Moderate Boon.description: The Keeper speeds your path toward learning new talents. You become permanently trained in two additional skills of your choice. Additionally, you can select a skill you are already trained in and permanently increase your proficiency rank in that skill, following the usual rules for skill increases.

Gruhastha - Moderate Curse.name: Gruhastha - Normaler Fluch
Gruhastha - Moderate Curse.description: Enlightenment begins to elude you, leaving you at a loss for knowledge. Whenever you attempt a check to Recall Knowledge, you use a result one degree of success worse than the result you rolled.

Hei Feng - Major Boon.name: Hei Feng - Starker Segen
Hei Feng - Major Boon.description: The instruments of the storm spare you from their fury. You ignore all effects and penalties caused by precipitation and winds, and you can see normally through fog, rain, and other weather conditions.

Hei Feng - Major Curse.name: Hei Feng - Starker Fluch
Hei Feng - Major Curse.description: The Duke of Thunder's ire follows you wherever you go. The weather in a 500-foot radius around you is always stormy. Roughly twice each minute you are outside, you are struck by a bolt of lightning that deals @Damage[10d6[electricity]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true] save).

Hei Feng - Minor Boon.name: Hei Feng - Schwacher Segen
Hei Feng - Minor Boon.description: The Heavenly Court's most boastful deity ensures your boasts hit home. Once, when you fail an Intimidation check, you critically succeed instead. Hei Feng grants this boon capriciously based on his mood, sometimes even for trivial or inconsequential boasts, and he sometimes grants it for other skill checks related to boasts.

Hei Feng - Minor Curse.name: Hei Feng - Schwacher Fluch
Hei Feng - Minor Curse.description: Hei Feng's belligerence hangs over you like a thunderhead. You take a -1 status penalty to checks with Charisma-based skills. If you consume even a drop of alcohol, this penalty becomes -3 until the next sunrise.

Hei Feng - Moderate Boon.name: Hei Feng - Normaler Segen
Hei Feng - Moderate Boon.description: Fair winds and currents speed your passage. Any vessel you use to travel over the sea gains a +10-foot status bonus to its Speeds.

Hei Feng - Moderate Curse.name: Hei Feng - Normaler Fluch
Hei Feng - Moderate Curse.description: Your heart is as quick to change as Hei Feng's. If you roll a failure on a saving throw against an emotion effect, you get a critical failure instead.

Iomedae - Major Boon.name: Iomedae - Starker Segen
Iomedae - Major Boon.description:
Iomedae imbues your blade with great power.

Longswords you wield gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DH0kB9Wbr5pDeunX]{Holy} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.woxl2FrrgAcJDu0t]{Major Striking} runes while you hold them. These property runes count toward the number of runes you can have on your weapon, and if this would cause your weapon to exceed its limit, choose which ones to keep each day when you prepare.

You gain a +2 status bonus to attack rolls with longswords.

Iomedae - Major Curse.name: Iomedae - Starker Fluch
Iomedae - Major Curse.description:
All blades reject your wicked heart.

Any weapon you wield automatically becomes broken after you Strike with it. This curse can't break artifacts or similarly powerful weapons.

Iomedae - Minor Boon.name: Iomedae - Schwacher Segen
Iomedae - Minor Boon.description:
You always present yourself at your best. Your clothing and person are always clean and unrumpled, the metal of your blade and armor shining and unblemished.

This doesn't prevent you from being exposed to diseases and other afflictions via filth, but it protects you as well as if you had washed thoroughly right away.

Iomedae - Minor Curse.name: Iomedae - Schwacher Fluch
Iomedae - Minor Curse.description: Your blade and armor have dulled like lead. Your weapons, armor, and shields have half their usual Hit Points and Break Threshold.

Iomedae - Moderate Boon.name: Iomedae - Normaler Segen
Iomedae - Moderate Boon.description: Normaler Segen (einmalig): Dein Herz schlägt mit entschlossener Tapferkeit. Einmalig beendet Iomedae alle negativen Effekte, die dich betreffen, es sei denn, sie stammen von einem Artefakt, einer Gottheit oder ähnlich mächtigen Quelle; sie stellt auch alle verlorenen Trefferpunkte wieder her und füllt deine Zaubersprüche, Fokuspunkte und anderen täglichen Ressourcen.

Iomedae - Moderate Curse.name: Iomedae - Normaler Fluch
Iomedae - Moderate Curse.description: Tactical advantages never seem to work the way you planned. You can't receive a circumstance bonus to your attack rolls, and enemies don't take any circumstance penalties to their AC against your attacks.

Irori - Major Boon.name: Irori - Starker Segen
Irori - Major Boon.description: Starker Segen: Du kannst vorübergehend eine größere Gestalt annehmen. Du kannst @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.MMCQsh12TPaDdPbV]{Göttliche Macht} auf Grad 8 einmal am Tag als immanenten okkulten Zauber wirken. Wenn du das tust, erscheint deine Gestalt als unscheinbar und nicht als mit einer mächtigen Rüstung ausgestattet.

Irori - Major Curse.name: Irori - Starker Fluch
Irori - Major Curse.description: Starker Fluch: Irori lässt alle Lebewesen deine Existenz vergessen. Dieses kann noch dadurch verschlimmert werden, dass du den Zorn von Irori steigerst, was dazu führen würde, dass dein Name auch aus allen schriftlichen Aufzeichnungen ausgelöscht wird. In beiden Fällen werden Erinnerungen und Schriften sich neu arrangieren und dich somit nahtlos ersetzen, anstatt offensichtliche Lücken zu hinterlassen.

Irori - Minor Boon.name: Irori - Schwacher Segen
Irori - Minor Boon.description: Schwacher Segen: Irori gewährt dir große Einsichten und Kenntnisse. Wenn du einmal einen Fehlschlag bei einem Fertigkeitswurf zum @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Wissen abrufen} würfelst, erhältst du stattdessen einen Kritischen Erfolg. Außerdem verliert der Fertigkeitswurf die Eigenschaft Verdeckt, so dass du sicher weißt, dass das Ergebnis ein Kritischer Erfolg ist. Irori gewährt diesen Segen in der Regel für einen äußerst folgenreichen Wurf des Wissen Abrufens.

Irori - Minor Curse.name: Irori - Schwacher Fluch
Irori - Minor Curse.description: Schwacher Fluch: Irori fordert dich heraus, einen anderen Weg zu suchen, anstatt jedes Problem wie einen Nagel zu behandeln, nur weil du einen Hammer hast. Wenn du einen Fertigkeitswurf auswählst, für den du einen höheren Bonus hast, wenn eine andere Methode der Situation eher angemessen wäre - etwa Täuschung nutzt, um dich durch das Leben zu @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{lügen}, weil es dein höchster Modifikator ist, auch wenn es besser wäre, eine Kompromiss mit Diplomatie zu suchen - musst du zweimal würfeln und das niedrigere Ergebnis nehmen.

Irori - Moderate Boon.name: Irori - Normaler Segen
Irori - Moderate Boon.description: Normaler Segen: Dein Körper baut sich nach Widrigkeiten wieder auf und wird stärker. Du kannst @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qJZZdYBdNaWRJFER]{Unversehrtheit des Körpers} als okkulten Ki-Zauber wirken. Wenn du noch keinen Fokusvorrat besitzt, erhältst du einen Vorrat mit 1 Fokuspunkt und den Kompetenzgrad Geübt in okkulten Zauber-Angriffswürfen und Zauber-SG (im GRW auf S. 157 findest du vollständige Informationen darüber, was passiert, wenn du deinen ersten Ki-Zauber erlangst).

Irori - Moderate Curse.name: Irori - Normaler Fluch
Irori - Moderate Curse.description: Normaler Fluch: Irori fordert dich heraus, dich an Widrigkeiten anzupassen, um dich selbst zu perfektionieren. Du wirst wie mit schweren Gewichten belastet und erhältst die Zustände @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Ungeschickt 2} und @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Belastet}, bis du eine herausfordernde Aufgabe erfüllst, die von Irori gewählt wurde.

Kazutal - Major Boon.name: Kazutal - Starker Segen
Kazutal - Major Boon.description: Kazutal smiles upon those who seek to offer aid, no matter how meek or helpless they may be. Any time creatures attempt a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} you, they can choose to automatically succeed. If a creature chooses to roll for the attempt and rolls a success, it gets a critical success instead, granting a +4 circumstance bonus even if it doesn't have legendary proficiency in that skill. You gain the same benefits when you attempt to Aid others.

Kazutal - Major Curse.name: Kazutal - Starker Fluch
Kazutal - Major Curse.description: You are cursed to depend upon others for your survival. You can't eat anything, drink anything, or use any gear or magic items unless they were willingly given to you by someone who rightfully owns them. Work-arounds like having an ally strip the gear from someone's corpse and then give it to you willingly automatically fail.

Kazutal - Minor Boon.name: Kazutal - Schwacher Segen
Kazutal - Minor Boon.description: With Kazutal's blessing, food tastes richer. Any meal that you eat tastes delicious and has improved nutritional value. This doesn't protect you from anything dangerous in your food, but it also doesn't prevent you from tasting those dangerous elements of the food.

Kazutal - Minor Curse.name: Kazutal - Schwacher Fluch
Kazutal - Minor Curse.description: Community opinion turns against you. Humanoids in your community who would normally start as indifferent toward you start as unfriendly instead.

Kazutal - Moderate Boon.name: Kazutal - Normaler Segen
Kazutal - Moderate Boon.description: You always seem to find safe shelter when you most need it. Once per day, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GzdgM0m7wXKuFSho]{Rope Trick} as a divine innate spell.

Kazutal - Moderate Curse.name: Kazutal - Normaler Fluch
Kazutal - Moderate Curse.description: Your strength betrays you, preventing you from taking more than your fair share. You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and can't carry anything beyond the gear you are actively wearing or using.

Kurgess - Major Boon.name: Kurgess - Starker Segen
Kurgess - Major Boon.description: You possess a true champion's might. When you roll a critical failure on an Athletics check, you get a failure instead, and when you roll a success, you instead get a critical success.

Kurgess - Major Curse.name: Kurgess - Starker Fluch
Kurgess - Major Curse.description: The wrath of Kurgess withers you almost to nothing. You are permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4}.

Kurgess - Minor Boon.name: Kurgess - Schwacher Segen
Kurgess - Minor Boon.description: The Strong Man blesses you with a measure of his strength. Increase your maximum and encumbered Bulk limits by 2.

Kurgess - Minor Curse.name: Kurgess - Schwacher Fluch
Kurgess - Minor Curse.description: Difficulty lifting burdens is a sign of divine disapproval. Your maximum and encumbered Bulk limits decrease by 2.

Kurgess - Moderate Boon.name: Kurgess - Normaler Segen
Kurgess - Moderate Boon.description: You fear no exertion. You can employ exploration tactics normally while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

Kurgess - Moderate Curse.name: Kurgess - Normaler Fluch
Kurgess - Moderate Curse.description: Kurgess's displeasure breaks your competitive edge, causing you to fail at the cusp of success. If your check result exactly equals the DC, you fail instead of succeeding.

Lamashtu - Major Boon.name: Lamaschtu - Starker Segen
Lamashtu - Major Boon.description: Starker Segen (täglich): Lamaschtu benutzt deinen Körper, um ein neues Monster zu gebären, unabhängig von deinem Geschlecht. Einmal pro Tag kannst du 1 Minute damit verbringen, ein durch den SL bestimmtes Monster zu gebären, das sich den Weg aus deinem Bauch reißt. Die Stufe des Monsters entspricht maximal deiner Stufe und es tut, was es will, dem Willen Lamaschtus folgend, obwohl es dich nicht angreift, es sei denn, du hast ihre Gunst verloren. Du erhältst den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Ausgelaugt 3} durch diese Tortur.

Lamashtu - Major Curse.name: Lamaschtu - Starker Fluch
Lamashtu - Major Curse.description: Your dreams are an unending stream of nightmares. You need 16 hours of rest to try to get enough sleep to recover resources in daily preparation that normally require an 8-hour rest, and even then, you must succeed at a @Check[type:flat|dc:15] to do so, and you are still fatigued on a successful check.

Lamashtu - Minor Boon.name: Lamaschtu - Schwacher Segen
Lamashtu - Minor Boon.description:
Lamashtu's touch mutates a part of your body.

You gain either an unarmed Strike that deals 1d6 damage or one that deals 1d4 damage and has the finesse and agile traits.

Whether the attack deals bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage depends on the mutation.

If the unarmed Strike replaces a limb, you can still use the mutated limb for its original functions. Lamashtu chooses the form and function of your mutation.

Lamashtu - Minor Curse.name: Lamaschtu - Schwacher Fluch
Lamashtu - Minor Curse.description: Horrid visions torment your mind, overlaying reality at inopportune times. You treat everything around you as if it was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}.

Lamashtu - Moderate Boon.name: Lamaschtu - Normaler Segen
Lamashtu - Moderate Boon.description: Normaler Segen (täglich): Du verbreitest Lamaschtus Albträume wohin du auch gehst. Du kann als immanenten göttlichen Zauber einmal am Tag @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LiGbewa9pO0yjbsY]{Verwirrung wirken}.

Lamashtu - Moderate Curse.name: Lamaschtu - Normaler Fluch
Lamashtu - Moderate Curse.description:
Lamashtu marks you as prey.

Any creature with imprecise or better scent can smell you from 100 × the usual range of their scent and can't shake the feeling that you smell like prey, so they might attack you even if they would normally avoid attacking creatures of your ancestry.

This smell doesn't magically compel their action, and the scent of prey doesn't overcome a deeper bond such as that with an animal companion.

Milani - Major Boon.name: Milani - Starker Segen
Milani - Major Boon.description: You gain +4 status bonus to checks to Request during attempts to satisfy one of Milani's edicts. Once per day, you can sound a battle cry that grants creatures within a 30-foot emanation the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]{Unfettered Movement} and affects all doors, locks, containers, and other bindings used to restrain or imprison others with the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6Ot4N22t5tPD51BO]{Knock} spell.

Milani - Major Curse.name: Milani - Starker Fluch
Milani - Major Curse.description: Small wounds bleed more than seems physically possible. Whenever you take slashing or piercing damage, you also take persistent bleed damage equal to the level of the creature or effect that inflicted the damage.

Milani - Minor Boon.name: Milani - Schwacher Segen
Milani - Minor Boon.description: Once, when you roll a failure on a Deception or Stealth check to protect an uprising from discovery, you critically succeed instead. Milani typically grants this boon for extremely significant checks on which the uprising's survival hinges.

Milani - Minor Curse.name: Milani - Schwacher Fluch
Milani - Minor Curse.description: A magical wreath of thorny, bloodred roses endlessly grows from your scalp, no matter how much you try to remove it. You gain weakness 5 to piercing damage.

Milani - Moderate Boon.name: Milani - Normaler Segen
Milani - Moderate Boon.description: When you use it to protect others, your shield blooms with roses brimming with razor-sharp thorns. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.5vXc2s2siR1ihpBT]{Shield Warden (Fighter)} feat, even if you don't meet its prerequisites. If you already had that feat, if your shield takes damage from a melee Strike in defense of your ally, the attacker takes piercing damage equal to half the shield's Hardness.

Milani - Moderate Curse.name: Milani - Normaler Fluch
Milani - Moderate Curse.description: Ropes, chains, manacles, and other equipment used to bind or constrain become blazing hot in your hands, bursting into flame or melting as if engulfed in a forge. When you attempt to hold such an item, you take @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage and the item is destroyed.

Nethys - Major Boon.name: Nethys - Starker Segen
Nethys - Major Boon.description:
You are granted supreme magical knowledge and mastery.

If you are a prepared spellcaster, you can switch one of your prepared spells for another spell you could have prepared in that slot; if you are a spontaneous spellcaster, you can switch one of the spells in your spell repertoire for another spell you could have chosen for your repertoire instead.

In either case, you make this switch by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait. (If you are neither a prepared nor a spontaneous spellcaster, Nethys won't grant you his major boon.)

Nethys - Major Curse.name: Nethys - Starker Fluch
Nethys - Major Curse.description: Nethys severs your connection to magic. You lose all your spellcasting abilities and cannot gain any future spellcasting.

Nethys - Minor Boon.name: Nethys - Schwacher Segen
Nethys - Minor Boon.description: Schwacher Segen (einmalig): Nethys spricht einen mächtigen Zauber, um dir in einem Notfall zu helfen. Nethys wirkt einmalig einen Zauberspruch, der 1 Stufe höher ist als der höchstgradigste Zauberspruch, den du wirken kannst. Wenn du keine Zaubersprüche beherrschst, spricht Nethys einen Zauber des ersten Grades, um dir zu helfen.

Nethys - Minor Curse.name: Nethys - Schwacher Fluch
Nethys - Minor Curse.description: The secrets of magic become mentally taxing. You are permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.

Nethys - Moderate Boon.name: Nethys - Normaler Segen
Nethys - Moderate Boon.description: Normaler Segen (einmalig): Nethys gewährt dir einen Einblick in die Geheimnisse der Magie. Du kannst einen Zauberspruch aus einer anderen Zaubertradition deiner Zauberliste hinzufügen. Du musst ihn aber immer noch lernen oder ganz normal zu deinem Zauberrepertoire hinzufügen.

Nethys - Moderate Curse.name: Nethys - Normaler Fluch
Nethys - Moderate Curse.description:
Your magic wars against itself like Nethys's dueling halves. Whenever you cast a spell, attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:11].

On a failure, if your spell was harmful, you instead cast a beneficial spell of the same rank on your intended targets, and if it was beneficial, you instead cast a harmful spell of the same rank on your intended targets.

If the spell benefited some targets and harmed others, you cast a spell of the same rank that switches who benefited (for instance, changing a heal spell that harmed undead and healed the living to a harm spell that healed undead and harmed the living).

You still lose the spell slot for the spell you were trying to cast.

Nivi Rhombodazzle - Major Boon.name: Nivi Rautenblender - Starker Segen
Nivi Rhombodazzle - Major Boon.description: Those who have done much to please Nivi find themselves slipping from sight when needed. Any time you attempt a Stealth check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Hide} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}, you also gain the effects of 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aEM2cttJ2eYcLssW]{Fleet Step} spells to help you elude your enemies. These effects last until the end of your next turn or until you stop Hiding or Sneaking, whichever comes first (you can continue to Hide or Sneak, turn after turn, to extend these effects).

Nivi Rhombodazzle - Major Curse.name: Nivi Rautenblender - Starker Fluch
Nivi Rhombodazzle - Major Curse.description: Nivi curses unworthy adherents with recklessness. Any time you are presented with a wager, you are compelled to accept, no matter the odds. If you succeed at a@Check[type:will|dc:40] save, you can at least attempt to alter the stakes of that wager in your favor, but you must still accept.

Nivi Rhombodazzle - Minor Boon.name: Nivi Rautenblender - Schwacher Segen
Nivi Rhombodazzle - Minor Boon.description: Those who have earned Nivi's trust are blessed with wild turns of luck in the worst of circumstances. Once, instead of attempting the check you would normally roll, you attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:11] with the same results. Nivi always grants this boon when the odds are stacked against you (though this same effect is an alternate to her minor curse if she uses it for a check when you would have been very likely to succeed).

Nivi Rhombodazzle - Minor Curse.name: Nivi Rautenblender - Schwacher Fluch
Nivi Rhombodazzle - Minor Curse.description: Those who betray Nivi's trust find defeat where there was sure to be victory. Once, when you roll a natural 20 on a die, the result becomes a natural 1 instead. Nivi typically uses this curse for maximum poetic justice.

Nivi Rhombodazzle - Moderate Boon.name: Nivi Rautenblender - Normaler Segen
Nivi Rhombodazzle - Moderate Boon.description: Nivi bestows a fraction of her skill at pushing consequences down the road. Once per day, after attempting a check, you can roll a second time. You must use the result of the second roll, even if it is worse. This is a fortune effect. At any point after you use this boon, the GM can replace one of your check results with the first result of the check you attempted when using this boon; this delayed result can't be further delayed, prevented, or affected in any way, even by other divine intercessions.

Nivi Rhombodazzle - Moderate Curse.name: Nivi Rautenblender - Normaler Fluch
Nivi Rhombodazzle - Moderate Curse.description: Those who arouse Nivi's wrath find themselves bound to the earth with no place to hide. You are wreathed in constant @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire} and constantly affected by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, and any effect that grants @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisibility} doesn't work on you.

Nocticula - Major Boon.name: Nocticula - Starker Segen
Nocticula - Major Boon.description: You become an idealized version of yourself, as if created by a divine artist. You permanently gain a set of 4 ability boosts that follow the same rules as the ability boosts you gain at every 5th level.

Nocticula - Major Curse.name: Nocticula - Starker Fluch
Nocticula - Major Curse.description: You are exiled from companionship. You can't communicate with any other creature, nor can you feel other creatures' touch.

Nocticula - Minor Boon.name: Nocticula - Schwacher Segen
Nocticula - Minor Boon.description: The night sky inspires you in a specific way. Once, when you roll a failure on a Crafting or Performance check under the night sky, you critically succeed instead. Nocticula typically grants this boon for a consequential piece of artwork or performance.

Nocticula - Minor Curse.name: Nocticula - Schwacher Fluch
Nocticula - Minor Curse.description: Midnight looms and obscures your fate. You are only able to see up to 60 feet away from you, regardless of the lighting or what senses you have.

Nocticula - Moderate Boon.name: Nocticula - Normaler Segen
Nocticula - Moderate Boon.description: You draw on the power of midnight to guide you on your journeys. You gain darkvision. If you already had darkvision, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c]{Darkness} once per day as a divine innate spell.

Nocticula - Moderate Curse.name: Nocticula - Normaler Fluch
Nocticula - Moderate Curse.description: You are plagued with doubt in your own skills. You are always untrained with Crafting, Performance, and one other skill (determined by the GM, but themed to the event that brought on your curse), regardless of any effect that would improve your proficiency. You can't retrain those skills.

Norgorber - Major Boon.name: Norgorber - Starker Segen
Norgorber - Major Boon.description: You become a living secret. You are immune to divination effects and attempts to magically alter your memory, unless you choose to be affected or those effects come from a deity, artifact, or similarly powerful source. You also can never be tricked or forced by mundane means into uttering a secret you wish to keep.

Norgorber - Major Curse.name: Norgorber - Starker Fluch
Norgorber - Major Curse.description:
Starker Fluch (täglich): Norgorber nimmt dir deine Erinnerungen. Wenn du nach einer Rast erwachst, musst du einmal am Tag 1W4 würfeln.

Bei einer 1 vergisst du die Ereignisse des vergangenen Tages für immer.

Bei einer 2 erlebst du an diesem Tag eine temporäre retrograde Amnesie und kannst dich an keine Ereignisse der Vergangenheit erinnern und auch nicht daran, wer du bist.

Bei einer 3 vergisst du zeitweilig eine wichtige Sache für diesen Tag (Norgorber wählt gerne eine Erinnerung, die Ärger verursacht, etwa das Vergessen des Lebensgefährten am Hochzeitstag).

Bei einer 4 erhältst du falsche Erinnerungen, die sich auf ein wichtiges Ereignis des Tages beziehen und sich nahtlos in die wahren Erinnerungen einfügen.

Norgorber - Minor Boon.name: Norgorber - Schwacher Segen
Norgorber - Minor Boon.description: Schwacher Segen: Norgorber schützt deine Geheimnisse und Lügen. Einmalig, wenn du bei einem Fertigkeitswurf für Täuschung, um zu Lügen, einen Fehlschlag erzielst, erhältst du stattdessen einen Kritischen Erfolg. Norgorber setzt diesen Segen meist zum Schutz einer äußerst folgenreichen Lüge ein.

Norgorber - Minor Curse.name: Norgorber - Schwacher Fluch
Norgorber - Minor Curse.description:
Norgorber allows thieves to get the better of you.

Whenever you Earn Income, you earn money as if the task were 2 levels lower due to theft, loss, or bad fortune.

Norgorber - Moderate Boon.name: Norgorber - Normaler Segen
Norgorber - Moderate Boon.description:
Your poisons are everlasting.

If your Strike with a poisoned weapon critically fails, or succeeds but fails to deal slashing or piercing damage, the poison is not spent. The poison is still spent once successfully applied to a creature.

Norgorber - Moderate Curse.name: Norgorber - Normaler Fluch
Norgorber - Moderate Curse.description: Poisons are quick to debilitate you. When you roll a failure at a Fortitude save against a poison, you get a critical failure instead.

Pharasma - Major Boon.name: Pharasma - Starker Segen
Pharasma - Major Boon.description:
Pharasma keeps you alive to fulfill your fate.

The GM secretly chooses a fate Pharasma knows you must fulfill. Until you fulfill this fate, any time you would die, a grave but nonfatal misfortune instead befalls you.

You take at least a full day to recuperate and you potentially face permanent consequences, but you don't die. If you would have died even once without this boon, once your fate is complete, you let out a final sigh and then die peacefully.

Pharasma - Major Curse.name: Pharasma - Starker Fluch
Pharasma - Major Curse.description: Pharasma wills the end of your life and your lineage. You become unable to have children (or otherwise procreate by any means, including create spawn abilities) and are permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}.

Pharasma - Minor Boon.name: Pharasma - Schwacher Segen
Pharasma - Minor Boon.description: Schwacher Segen: Du kannst kurz einen prophetischen Blick auf dein aktuelles Schicksal werfen. Du erhältst einmalig einen Zustandsbonus von +2 auf einen einzelnen Wurf. Du kannst diesen Bonus anwenden, nachdem du das Ergebnis ermittelt hast, und potenziell auch den Grad des Erfolgs verändern.

Pharasma - Minor Curse.name: Pharasma - Schwacher Fluch
Pharasma - Minor Curse.description: Horrifying or enticing visions of your final judgment distract you from the task at hand. You take a -2 status penalty to initiative rolls.

Pharasma - Moderate Boon.name: Pharasma - Normaler Segen
Pharasma - Moderate Boon.description:
You gain a greater mastery over the energies of life and death.

Your Strikes deal 1 vitality damage to undead.

Your spells that deal vitality damage to undead gain a +1 status bonus to damage per spell rank, and your spells that heal the living gain a +1 status bonus to the Hit Points restored per spell rank.

Pharasma - Moderate Curse.name: Pharasma - Normaler Fluch
Pharasma - Moderate Curse.description: Normaler Fluch: Das Schicksal wendet sich gegen dich und offenbart schreckliche Vorzeichen. Weissagungen, wie etwa von dir gezauberte @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Vorahnung} oder solche, die dich mit einbeziehen, deuten immer Übles an. Nachdem du einen Fertigkeitswurf abgelegt hast, kann der SL einmal pro Tag das Ergebnis in eine natürliche 1 verwandeln.

Rovagug - Major Boon.name: Rovagug - Starker Segen
Rovagug - Major Boon.description: You can crack the surface of Golarion, accelerating the release of the Rough Beast. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.FMjihpGLn9eQ14Gw]{Quaking Stomp} barbarian feat.

Rovagug - Major Curse.name: Rovagug - Starker Fluch
Rovagug - Major Curse.description:
You are useful only as a beacon of destruction.

You are permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, rampaging against anything and everything in your sight, and you deal an additional 18 damage with your unarmed and weapon Strikes.

Rovagug - Minor Boon.name: Rovagug - Schwacher Segen
Rovagug - Minor Boon.description: Schwacher Segen: Dein Angriff wird noch zerstörerischer. Einer deiner fehlgeschlagenen oder erfolgreichen Angriffe wird einmalig zu einem kritischen Treffer und deine Waffe oder dein waffenloser Angriff erhält die Eigenschaft Gefährlich W12 für diesen Angriff. Dies ersetzt jede Gefährlich Eigenschaft, welche sie bereits hatte. Rovagug gewährt diesen Segen in der Regel dann, wenn der kritische Treffer etwas Kostbares oder Bedeutsames zerstören könnte.

Rovagug - Minor Curse.name: Rovagug - Schwacher Fluch
Rovagug - Minor Curse.description:
Whenever you are imprisoned, you thrash and shake as your mind fills with desperation.

Any time you are restrained or otherwise imprisoned (such as being sent to jail), you are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

Rovagug - Moderate Boon.name: Rovagug - Normaler Segen
Rovagug - Moderate Boon.description:
You can devour all. You mouth grows into a horrible circular, insectile maw of needle-like teeth.

You gain a bite unarmed attack that deals 1d8 piercing damage.

Additionally, you can stomach eating anything you can fit down your throat-even rocks or small objects.

You gain a +4 status bonus to saves resulting from eating something, such as diseases, poisons, or other effects of the ingested object. This doesn't allow you to digest magic items that would otherwise be difficult or impossible to destroy, such as cursed items or artifacts.

Rovagug - Moderate Curse.name: Rovagug - Normaler Fluch
Rovagug - Moderate Curse.description:
Your destructive rage seeks to remain unbound.

Any armor you wear automatically becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken}. Other items in your possession occasionally become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken} over time.

Sarenrae - Major Boon.name: Sarenrae - Starker Segen
Sarenrae - Major Boon.description:
You are a voice of peace and rehabilitation.

When you roll a success at a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request} something, you get a critical success instead.

In addition, all creatures other than fiends, undead, and mindless creatures allow you one chance to speak your piece and make requests before entering combat. If you or an ally ever use the time from the request to gain an advantage in an ensuing combat (for example, by casting preparatory spells, positioning for combat, or waiting out your opponent's preparatory spells), Sarenrae immediately revokes this boon, or possibly curses your ally.

Sarenrae - Major Curse.name: Sarenrae - Starker Fluch
Sarenrae - Major Curse.description:
Sarenrae restricts your ability to harm others.

All attacks you make, spells you cast, and other sources of damage you deal are nonlethal except against fiends and undead, and you can't ever make them lethal.

You deal minimum damage except against fiends and undead.

All creatures except fiends and undead gain a +4 status bonus to their AC and saving throws against your attacks and other effects.

Sarenrae - Minor Boon.name: Sarenrae - Schwacher Segen
Sarenrae - Minor Boon.description: Schwacher Segen: Deine heilenden Hände sind mit einer warmen Flamme gesegnet. Wenn du eine andere Kreatur heilst, heilst du sie einmalig, anstatt sie für den normalen Betrag zu heilen, auf volle Trefferpunkte, egal wie viel Schaden sie erlitten hat. Sarenrae gewährt diesen Segen in der Regel in äußerst kritischen Situationen.

Sarenrae - Minor Curse.name: Sarenrae - Schwacher Fluch
Sarenrae - Minor Curse.description: The sun burns you for your transgression. You receive a sunburn that causes you to become permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}.

Sarenrae - Moderate Boon.name: Sarenrae - Normaler Segen
Sarenrae - Moderate Boon.description: Your blade burns the irredeemable. Your attacks deal an additional 1d6 fire damage that ignores fire resistance.

Sarenrae - Moderate Curse.name: Sarenrae - Normaler Fluch
Sarenrae - Moderate Curse.description:
The sun shines its light on everything you say.

You become unable to tell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lies}, and if you attempt to do so, you instead compulsively blurt out the truth on the matter in question. You are still able to withhold information or lie by omission.

Shelyn - Major Boon.name: Schelyn - Starker Segen
Shelyn - Major Boon.description:
Your inner beauty and love surround you in an aura.

As long as you bear them no ill will, all creatures other than fiends, undead, and mindless creatures start with an attitude of friendly toward you, unless they would have been helpful instead. This doesn't mean they are willing to change their life or plans for you, and this boon does not prevent their attitudes from worsening if you try to thwart them. This effect doesn't work against deities and similarly powerful creatures.

Additionally, the love you share with your friends inspires them. You and your allies gain a +3 status bonus to saving throws and skill checks as long as you can see each other.

Shelyn - Major Curse.name: Schelyn - Starker Fluch
Shelyn - Major Curse.description:
Those who spread misery via false love face Shelyn's greatest curse.

You lose the ability to distinguish any living being from another through appearance, voice, scent, or similar sensory means. You can make out physical size (so you wouldn't mistake an ant for a horse), but nothing further.

If you were merely shallow, every creature you see has generic, bland features, but if your deeds were vile, you see only the faces of those you have wronged.

Shelyn - Minor Boon.name: Schelyn - Schwacher Segen
Shelyn - Minor Boon.description:
Once, when you roll a failure on a Diplomacy check, you get a critical success instead.

Shelyn typically grants this boon only when the Diplomacy check would serve to increase love or offer a chance of redemption.

Shelyn - Minor Curse.name: Schelyn - Schwacher Fluch
Shelyn - Minor Curse.description:
You heart churns with remorse. Each day, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} as a specific misdeed plays out in your mind over and over in guilt.

You can't remove this condition, though it abates enough for you to quickly eat and drink when necessary. If you make amends or otherwise earnestly pursue redemption for the misdeed, the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} condition fades completely that day.

Shelyn - Moderate Boon.name: Schelyn - Normaler Segen
Shelyn - Moderate Boon.description: You are inspired to create great works and become a virtuoso at all arts. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.QLeMH5mQgh28sa5o]{Specialty Crafting} feat and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.lFwfUvH2708rl6i3]{Virtuosic Performer} feat in all categories of Crafting and Performance.

Shelyn - Moderate Curse.name: Schelyn - Normaler Fluch
Shelyn - Moderate Curse.description:
Others subconsciously recognize your past betrayals.

Whenever you attempt a Diplomacy check and roll a failure, you get a critical failure instead, and if you roll a critical success, you get a success instead.

Shizuru - Major Boon.name: Schizuru - Starker Segen
Shizuru - Major Boon.description: Shizuru bestows upon you a golden suit of armor made from sunlight, or transforms your favorite armor to gain that aspect. Once per hour while you are wearing the armor, if an attack would reduce your Hit Points to 0, the attack is instead completely negated.

Shizuru - Major Curse.name: Schizuru - Starker Fluch
Shizuru - Major Curse.description: Those who incite Shizuru's personal wrath earn the hatred of all of her subjects. All imperial dragons and animals you encounter are automatically hostile to you, and you gain weakness 15 to draconic breath weapons.

Shizuru - Minor Boon.name: Schizuru - Schwacher Segen
Shizuru - Minor Boon.description: Your attacks help eradicate darkness. When you successfully Strike a foe, your weapon glows with bright light out to 60 feet for 1 minute. This is a light effect with a counteract rank equal to half your level rounded up.

Shizuru - Minor Curse.name: Schizuru - Schwacher Fluch
