Shizuru - Minor Curse.description: Your equipment turns on you for a disgraceful act. The next time you make an attack, your weapon or armor gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken} condition.

Shizuru - Moderate Boon.name: Schizuru - Normaler Segen
Shizuru - Moderate Boon.description: Shizuru's light flows through your blade. Your weapons and unarmed attacks deal an additional 1d6 fire damage or 1d6 spirit damage; you choose each time you make an attack.

Shizuru - Moderate Curse.name: Schizuru - Normaler Fluch
Shizuru - Moderate Curse.description: Shizuru decrees that her light is no longer your ally. You gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.I0HYG0ctCLP5JRsW]{Light Blindness}.

Sivanah - Major Boon.name: Sivanah - Starker Segen
Sivanah - Major Boon.description: You spread your illusions over a larger area. You can designate an area to permanently gain the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage}. All creatures within this area gain the effects of illusory disguise, changing their forms as you wish. You can designate a new area as a 1-minute activity, but doing so dismisses any previously designated areas.

Sivanah - Major Curse.name: Sivanah - Starker Fluch
Sivanah - Major Curse.description: Mirrors break whenever you cross their paths. You cannot be concealed by illusion magic of any kind (the spell automatically fails), and all creatures that see you know your true identity.

Sivanah - Minor Boon.name: Sivanah - Schwacher Segen
Sivanah - Minor Boon.description: Sivanah prevents your enemies from pulling off your veil. Once, when a foe rolls a success on a Perception check to disbelieve your illusion, it gets a critical failure instead. Sivanah typically grants this benefit to protect an elaborate or consequential illusory deception, and she never uses it to improve the effect of a harmful illusion.

Sivanah - Minor Curse.name: Sivanah - Schwacher Fluch
Sivanah - Minor Curse.description: Your hair becomes a wild variety of colors, which cannot be altered with mundane or magical means, and it somehow grows out from under any cap, scarf, or other headwear intended to disguise it. You gain a -2 status penalty to Deception skill checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate} anyone else.

Sivanah - Moderate Boon.name: Sivanah - Normaler Segen
Sivanah - Moderate Boon.description: You wear a veil of illusion wherever you go. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]{Illusory Disguise} at will as an innate divine spell.

Sivanah - Moderate Curse.name: Sivanah - Normaler Fluch
Sivanah - Moderate Curse.description: Those who betray the secrets of others find their own secrets laid bare. Each person from whom you are keeping a secret immediately learns one of your secrets involving that person. This curse doesn't give away other people's secrets you are keeping, only your own.

Torag - Major Boon.name: Torag - Starker Segen
Torag - Major Boon.description:
Standing watch or guarding a location counts as resting for you, preventing you from being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} due to lack of rest as long as you stand watch for at least 6 hours a day.

You can recover your Focus Points (if you have them) by standing guard in addition to any other options you have available.

When on guard, you gain a +4 status bonus to Perception to notice ambushes and other dangers approaching.

As long as you are holding a shield, you are always Defending during exploration without needing to move at half your travel speed, and you can perform another exploration activity as well.

While you are using a shield, its Hardness increases by 5.

Torag - Major Curse.name: Torag - Starker Fluch
Torag - Major Curse.description: You are forever cast out from your home. Members of your community have their attitudes towards you shift two steps worse, meaning those who used to be helpful are now indifferent, those who were friendly are now unfriendly, and all others are now hostile. This doesn't necessarily result in violence, but hostile community members generally seek your permanent exile.

Torag - Minor Boon.name: Torag - Schwacher Segen
Torag - Minor Boon.description: Schwacher Segen: Torag repariert deine Ausrüstung, damit du weiter Wache halten kannst. Ein Schild, eine Waffe oder ein anderer Gegenstand, den du hältst oder am Leib trägst, erhält alle seine Trefferpunkte zurück. Die Härte des Gegenstandes verdoppelt sich 1 Minute lang. Torag kann diesen Segen genau in dem Augenblick verleihen, wenn der Gegenstand zerstört worden wäre, was diesen rettet. Gelegentlich gewährt Torag diesen Segen, um einen für die zwergische Geschichte wichtigen Gegenstand wiederherzustellen, der bereits völlig vernichtet worden war.

Torag - Minor Curse.name: Torag - Schwacher Fluch
Torag - Minor Curse.description: Shoddy artisanship makes itself known. Whenever an item you're using takes damage, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken}.

Torag - Moderate Boon.name: Torag - Normaler Segen
Torag - Moderate Boon.description:
You are counted as family among Torag and his followers.

You gain the effects of a single dwarf ancestry feat of Torag's choice, even if you are not a dwarf, as long as you maintain Torag's blessing.

Torag - Moderate Curse.name: Torag - Normaler Fluch
Torag - Moderate Curse.description:
You must prove your skills at a craft by providing your own equipment.

You gain item bonuses only from items you make yourself.

Tsukiyo - Major Boon.name: Tsukiyo - Starker Segen
Tsukiyo - Major Boon.description: Tsukiyo shares some of his own nature and can lead a favored soul back along the same path he has walked. The next time you would die, you are instead instantly restored to full health and lose any negative conditions you have.

Tsukiyo - Major Curse.name: Tsukiyo - Starker Fluch
Tsukiyo - Major Curse.description: When Tsukiyo truly loses patience with someone, he forces them to experience the hardships of others firsthand. Whenever you touch another creature or another creature touches you, you immediately gain any negative curses, diseases, and conditions they are suffering. These effects spread to you even when you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strike} another creature or a creature Strikes you.

Tsukiyo - Minor Boon.name: Tsukiyo - Schwacher Segen
Tsukiyo - Minor Boon.description: Tsukiyo's simplest show of gratitude is a gift of clarity. Once, when you roll a failure on a saving throw against a mental effect, you get a critical success instead. Tsukiyo typically grants this boon against a particularly consequential mental effect.

Tsukiyo - Minor Curse.name: Tsukiyo - Schwacher Fluch
Tsukiyo - Minor Curse.description: Those who offend Tsukiyo find that light actively shuns them. You lose any low-light vision or darkvision you have, and you treat all light levels as one step lower.

Tsukiyo - Moderate Boon.name: Tsukiyo - Normaler Segen
Tsukiyo - Moderate Boon.description: Tsukiyo watches over you and guards your sleep. You are guaranteed a peaceful night's rest no matter what conditions you are sleeping in. Even nightmare and similar abilities can't disrupt your sleep unless they come from a deity, artifact, or similarly powerful source.

Tsukiyo - Moderate Curse.name: Tsukiyo - Normaler Fluch
Tsukiyo - Moderate Curse.description: If Tsukiyo is particularly offended by someone, they may find themselves lost in delusions of moonlight. When attempting to navigate or find something at night, if you roll a success or critical success on your Perception check, Survival check, or other check to do so, you get a failure instead.

Urgathoa - Major Boon.name: Urgathoa - Starker Segen
Urgathoa - Major Boon.description:
When you contract contagions, you experience fever dreams filled with insight.

Once afflicted with a disease, you gain the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qsNeG9KZpODSACMq]{Foresight} with yourself as the target until no longer afflicted with any disease.

Urgathoa - Major Curse.name: Urgathoa - Starker Fluch
Urgathoa - Major Curse.description:
Urgathoa teaches you that pointless lives in slavery to death and morality are bound to end in tragedy.

You develop an incurable wasting disease that leaves you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy} 2, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, and unable to move except by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Tj055UcNm6UEgtCg]{Crawling}. This disease never progresses further to kill you, but it passes to your friends and loved ones merely by sight, wasting them away unto death before your eyes and causing them to rise as undead to haunt you.

Urgathoa - Minor Boon.name: Urgathoa - Schwacher Segen
Urgathoa - Minor Boon.description: You feast on the spoils of life and death. You gain the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.heritages.Item.gyoN45SVfRZwHMkk]{Irongut Goblin} heritage, regardless of your ancestry. If you already have this heritage, the circumstance bonus increases to +4.

Urgathoa - Minor Curse.name: Urgathoa - Schwacher Fluch
Urgathoa - Minor Curse.description:
You must overindulge or partake in forbidden feasts before you find yourself even remotely sated.

You need to eat 20 times as much food as normal to avoid starvation, though you always feel hungry regardless of how much you eat.

If you dine on the flesh and blood of sapient creatures, you need to eat only the normal amount of such meals and your hunger abates.

Urgathoa - Moderate Boon.name: Urgathoa - Normaler Segen
Urgathoa - Moderate Boon.description: Urgathoa blesses you as one of her children. You gain void healing.

Urgathoa - Moderate Curse.name: Urgathoa - Normaler Fluch
Urgathoa - Moderate Curse.description: Urgathoa cuts you off from vitality energy without granting you the blessing of undeath. You are harmed by vitality effects and don't recover Hit Points from them, as if you were an undead or had void healing, but you are still harmed by void effects as normal.

Zon-Kuthon - Major Boon.name: Zon-Kuthon - Starker Segen
Zon-Kuthon - Major Boon.description: Shadows are deeper around you. darkvision and greater darkvision cannot penetrate darkness within 60 feet of you, but you can see through it normally.

Zon-Kuthon - Major Curse.name: Zon-Kuthon - Starker Fluch
Zon-Kuthon - Major Curse.description:
Zon-Kuthon steals away your joy, leaving you with only pain.

You lose that which you cherish the most forever, and lose the ability to feel joy. You can't gain benefits from emotion effects based on positive emotions.

If Zon-Kuthon feels you are ready to renounce, destroy, mutilate, or torture that which you once cherished most, he might return it to you to allow you to do so.

Zon-Kuthon - Minor Boon.name: Zon-Kuthon - Schwacher Segen
Zon-Kuthon - Minor Boon.description: Schwacher Segen: Der Herr der Mitternacht verwandelt dein Blut und deinen Schmerz in Ketten aus tiefster Finsternis, die deine Feinde vernichten. Wenn du Hieb-, Stich- oder Blutungsschaden erleidest, dann schießen 1 Minute lang Ketten aus deinem Körper, die Kreaturen in einer Linie von deiner Position aus in Richtung des auslösenden Angriffs betreffen (oder in eine Richtung deiner Wahl bei Blutungsschaden oder solchem, den du dir selber zugefügt hast). Dies hat den Effekt des Zaubers @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.k34hDOfIIMAxNL4a]{Finstere Tentakel} mit einem Grad, der der Hälfte deiner Stufe (aufgerundet) entspricht, und der den höchsten deiner Zauber-SG besitzt (bzw. 10 + deine Stufe + WE-Modifikator, wenn du keinen Zauber-SG hast).

Zon-Kuthon - Minor Curse.name: Zon-Kuthon - Schwacher Fluch
Zon-Kuthon - Minor Curse.description: You are surrounded by spectral chains that cause you to always be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered} and that have the same effects as armor with the noisy trait.

Zon-Kuthon - Moderate Boon.name: Zon-Kuthon - Normaler Segen
Zon-Kuthon - Moderate Boon.description: Normaler Segen: Jeden Morgen während deiner täglichen Vorbereitungen bilden Narben Worte auf deiner Haut. Diese Narben fungieren wie eine Schriftrolle eines göttlichen Zaubers, den Zon-Kuthon auswählt. Der Segen verschwindet für den Rest des Tages, wenn du diesen Zauber anwendest oder magisch geheilt wirst. Allerdings bleiben unter Umständen manche oder alle Narben zur Erinnerung bestehen.

Zon-Kuthon - Moderate Curse.name: Zon-Kuthon - Normaler Fluch
Zon-Kuthon - Moderate Curse.description:
You share the pain of others, and even minor wounds bring you incredible pain.

Whenever you see (or otherwise sense) a creature take damage, you take @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage.

Whenever you take damage any other way than from the first part of this curse, you take @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage from increased pain and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. Mental damage from this curse ignores any resistance you have to mental damage.
